intro: Liparia badocana, commonly known as the Philippine liparia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are typically finely divided and aromatic, similar to other members of its family. Liparia badocana is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and rocky slopes.
